page.title: 03Coughton Fields Farm
page.content: A farm typical of this area is Coughton Fields Farm. Farmed by its owner since 1929, it has 127 Friesian dairy cows, about 200 beef cattle and a Hereford-cross bull. Crops for animal feed include barley, fodder beet and grass for hay or silage. In summer dairy cows eat grass in the fields. Calves eat cow cake made from barley, bran and molasses. Beef cattle are fattened on barley and sold at Banbury market. The milk goes to a Redditch dairy. The farm covers 415 acres and six people work there. Buildings include a 10-unit herring-bone milking parlour, bull pens, winter housing for dairy cows, calving sheds and a grain dryer. Artificial fertilizers and weed killers are used. Land drainage on the heavy clay has been a major improvement. There are 45 machines.
